revised_title: Pleistocene Geology and Geomorphology of Three Gaps in the Midland Jurassic Escarpment
tldr: This article investigates the Pleistocene geology and geomorphology of three gaps in the Midland Jurassic escarpment. The authors study four areas, focusing on the Itchen drainage basin, Cherwell Valley, Moreton gap, and Daventry-Kilsby-Rugby area. They analyze the possible overflow points of glacial Lake Harrison and its connection to the surrounding rivers and landscape. The research provides insights into the history of the ice sheets and the formation of the landscape during the Pleistocene period.
